bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, August 13, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests information on Lazear's relationship to Washington and Jefferson College. He offers a contribution for Moran's travel expenses to attend the Founders' Day celebration.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, August 13, 1940
div1.p:
In a very few days, I will send you my memorandum on my trip to Havana,
and the status of my yellow fever historical researches so far. I will then ask
you to write letters to three or four people who will, I am sure, help me more
if they know that you, representing the college, appreciate their efforts.

In the meantime, can you give me the official dope on Lazear's connection
with W. and J.? I have not seen W. and J. mentioned in any of his previous bio-
graphies. One biography said he had gone to “Trinity Hall“, a private school
in Washington, Pennsylvania. He graduated from Johns Hopkins in 1889, presumably
from the academic department, and from Columbia Medical School in 1892. Is
“Trinity Hall” a part of W. and J. or has it since been incorporated into W.
and J.?

Will you also send me the exact date of the October meeting? I am
finding out how much a round trip from Havana to Washington, Pennsylvania
would be and will see to it that you receive a check from me for that amount;
but Mr. Moran thought it was possible that Mr. Pew or the company would pay
his way, and I said nothing about my willingness to pay, thinking that you could
use my check for some other purpose perhaps. I personally want to make this
contribution, and if he doesn't get the money from Pew, I think it is better
for the money to apparently come from the college rather than from me personally.
div1.closer:
Always yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. Dr. Ralph C. Hutchison
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
P.S. Our local office tells me that the railroad fare, first-class, between
Pittsburgh and Havana by way of Miami--Havana to Miami by boat and Miami to Pittsburgh
by train, is $129.15, perhaps a little bit less than the winter excursion rate. The
first class rate by boat from Miami to New York is $75.00 to $90.00 round trip, $25.25
railroad fare round trip between New York and Pittsburgh with Pullman charge of $3.15
each way or a maximum of $131.55, making it approximately the same whether he comes by
rail or by boat. I enclose a check for $150.00 to cover these expenses. If you can get
the money from Pew, you can use it for some other, perhaps even more worthy, purpose
for W. and J.
P.S.H.
